title: Back to the future: Signify increases the energy efficiency of LED lamps - LEDs Magazine
summary: Signify has increased the energy efficiency of its Philips brand Ultra Efficient (UE) LED lamps by 43% to 50%, adding new models for various environments including roadways, retail, and homes. These advancements are a part of Signify's ongoing efforts in sustainability, including IoT and circular economy initiatives.

title: Assessment of green technology innovation on energy-environmental efficiency in China under the influence of ... - Nature.com
summary: The article discusses the analysis of spatial autocorrelation in various environmental indicators and the impact of Green Technology Innovation (GTI) on Energy Efficiency Enhancements (EEE), emphasizing a complex relationship between GTI, Environmental Regulations (ER), and EEE. It finds a U-shaped relationship where initial GTI implementation may reduce EEE but eventually leads to improvements once critical thresholds are reached. The article also explores the effects of subcategories of GTI on different types of energy efficiency and conducts robustness tests for reliability.
green_innovation: TRUE - The analysis focuses on Green Technology Innovation (GTI) aimed at enhancing energy efficiency and promoting sustainable practices, which aligns with environmental sustainability goals.

green_product: FALSE - The article does not specifically identify a product that meets the definition of a green product; it focuses on processes and innovations in technology rather than specific goods.
green_process: TRUE - The article describes processes related to Green Technology Innovation aimed at minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability in energy efficiency.

The American Style handle set has a locking cylinder above the handle for quick locking and enhanced functionality. This new hardware is designed to improve French door operation and is available in various styles and finishes. Kolbe's president highlights the convenience and aesthetic appeal of the new offerings.
green_innovation: FALSE: The article does not indicate any significant environmental benefits or sustainability aspects related to the products mentioned.
business_innovation: TRUE: The introduction of new handle sets with innovative locking functionality represents a new product that differs significantly from previous products offered by the company.
green_product: FALSE: While the product may have functional benefits, there is no reference to its environmental impact or sustainability characteristics.
green_process: FALSE: The article does not describe any manufacturing or operational processes aimed at minimizing environmental impact.

title: Rothy's Fills Sustainability Role; Fashion's Biomass Move Causes Pollution, Deforestation: Short Takes - Yahoo Movies Canada
summary: Rothy’s has appointed James Rogers as vice president of sustainability to enhance the company's circular economy initiatives and minimize its environmental impact throughout the supply chain. The company produces footwear from recycled plastic bottles and has implemented a take-back program to recycle its products. Meanwhile, a report from Stand Earth critiques the fashion industry's use of biomass as a renewable energy source, arguing it contributes to deforestation and increases carbon emissions instead of reducing them.
green_innovation: TRUE: Rothy's initiatives focus on recycling materials and reducing environmental impacts across the supply chain, aligning with green innovation goals.
business_innovation: TRUE: The appointment of Rogers and Rothy's development of circular economy initiatives represent significant improvements in their business processes related to sustainability.
green_product: TRUE: Rothy's footwear, made from recycled plastic bottles and designed for minimal environmental impact, qualifies as a green product.
green_process: TRUE: The 3D knitting process used by Rothy's minimizes waste during production, which aligns with the definition of a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 316210 - Footwear Manufacturing, 314110 - Hosiery and Sock Mills, 313310 - Textile and Fabric Finishing Mills, 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not suggest any misleading claims by Rothy's about its sustainability practices; instead, it highlights their genuine efforts in sustainability.

title: Groz-Beckert innovates with Mayer & Cie. - Knitting Industry
summary: Groz-Beckert has developed an optimized sinker and an energy-saving needle in cooperation with Mayer & Cie, focusing on efficiency, energy savings, and increased process reliability. The innovative products demonstrated potential for quieter operation, increased service life, and energy savings of up to 20%. Their collaboration emphasized openness and partnership across various departments, benefiting customers of both companies. These innovations were showcased at ITMA events in 2023.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the innovations introduced (optimized Relanit sinkers and LCmax energy-saving needles) aim to reduce energy consumption and enhance process sustainability, thereby contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the newly developed products significantly differ from previous offerings and have been introduced into the market, reflecting a clear advancement in Groz-Beckert's product line.
green_product: TRUE, because both the optimized sinker and the LCmax needle are designed to minimize environmental impact through increased energy efficiency and reduced wear, fitting the definition of green products.
green_process: TRUE, as the development and application of these products focus on minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability in the production processes.
product_or_process: Relanit sinker SNK F and LCmax energy-saving needle

title: Kamala Harris roasted over Thanksgiving photo with gas stove - New York Post
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris faced backlash for a Thanksgiving tweet showcasing a gas stove, which some users criticized as hypocritical given recent discussions about banning such appliances due to environmental concerns. While the Biden administration expressed no support for a federal gas stove ban, regulatory proposals from the Department of Energy aimed at improving energy efficiency have reignited debate. These proposals could affect many existing gas cooktops, although the administration maintains that there are no plans for an outright ban. Additionally, some states have moved toward legislation favoring electric cooking options.
green_innovation: FALSE: The article discusses a gas stove, which is not promoting environmental sustainability or reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: FALSE: The article does not present a new or improved product or business process introduced on the market; it focuses on ongoing regulatory discussions.
green_product: FALSE: A gas stove does not meet the definition of a green product as it does not significantly reduce environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: FALSE: The article does not describe any method or technique in manufacturing or production that minimizes environmental impacts or promotes sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 335211 - Electric Housewares and Household Fan Manufacturing; 335228 - Other Major Household Appliance Manufacturing; 423620 - Household Appliances, Electric, Merchant Wholesalers; 811412 - Appliance Repair and Maintenance
greenwashing: TRUE: The criticism regarding the use of a gas stove while being part of an administration that discusses potential bans suggests an act of greenwashing; it implies a contradiction between public messaging on environmental issues and personal actions.

title: Ericsson Unveils Latest Generation of Processors in the Ericsson RAN Compute Portfolio - The Fast Mode
summary: Ericsson announced its latest generation of RAN Compute products, which includes advanced hardware designed for 5G networks. The new portfolio features energy-efficient processors and routers that significantly reduce power consumption and operational costs while enabling efficient spectrum utilization. These innovations aim to support mobile network demands, helping communications service providers future-proof their technologies. The release aligns with Ericsson's commitment to sustainable, high-performing networks.
green_innovation: TRUE: The new RAN Compute products incorporate energy-efficient technology and significantly reduce power consumption, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE: The introduction of the new advanced RAN Compute products signifies a significant improvement over Ericsson's previous offerings, thus qualifying as business innovation.

title: India's prodigious show on lighting 'LED Expo New Delhi 2023' opens today - TimesTech
summary: The LED Expo New Delhi 2023 showcases advanced lighting solutions and innovations, focusing on energy efficiency, sustainability, and smart lighting technologies. Industry leaders and experts gathered to discuss the significant growth and transformation in the LED lighting sector in India. The event features over 250 product launches, educational sessions, and highlights the importance of eco-friendly lighting solutions. The expo runs from November 2 to 4, 2023, at the India Expo Mart in Greater Noida.

title: Call for views launched on updated energy efficiency standards for social housing - Scottish Housing News
summary: The Scottish Government has launched a consultation on updated energy efficiency standards for social housing, aiming for a Social Housing Net Zero Standard by 2045 that includes clean heating solutions and improved fabric efficiency. The proposals outline timelines for phasing out fossil fuel heating systems and emphasize the role of social landlords in the transition to net zero. The response from various sector leaders indicates a commitment to reducing energy costs and carbon emissions, although concerns regarding funding and transition costs remain prevalent.
green_innovation: TRUE; the proposed standards and regulations aim to decarbonize social housing and improve energy efficiency, which directly contributes to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE; the consultation represents an innovative approach in establishing new energy efficiency standards and heat transition plans for social housing, differing significantly from previous processes.
green_product: FALSE; while the article discusses changes to heating systems and energy standards, it does not specifically name a good or service that qualifies as a green product.
green_process: TRUE; the article discusses a method for transitioning to cleaner heat systems and improving energy efficiency in social housing, which aligns with the definition of a green process.

title: Suffolk Building Society launches new eco self-build product - Financial Reporter
summary: Suffolk Building Society has launched a new eco self-build mortgage with lower interest rates and fees for borrowers building energy-efficient properties. The mortgage incentivizes self-builders and renovators by providing reduced rates based on their Energy Performance Certificate ratings. Features qualifying for the mortgage include solar panels, heat pumps, and higher insulation levels, aimed at improving energy efficiency. The society is also committed to being carbon neutral in its operations by 2030.
green_innovation: TRUE: This is green innovation because it promotes the construction of energy-efficient homes by offering financial incentives to borrowers who implement environmentally-friendly features.
business_innovation: TRUE: This is a business innovation because it introduces a new financial product (eco self-build mortgage) that significantly differs from standard self-build mortgages and has been brought to market.
green_product: FALSE: While the mortgage product incentivizes green construction, the mortgage itself is not a good or service that reduces environmental impact; rather, it encourages the adoption of green products in building.
green_process: FALSE: The article does not specifically describe a method or technique used in manufacturing or production that minimizes environmental impact, but rather discusses a financial product that supports green building.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 531311 - Residential Property Managers, 522292 - Real Estate Credit, 541613 - Marketing Consulting Services, 523930 - Investment Advice
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not appear to be an example of greenwashing as it transparently outlines the financial incentives for constructing energy-efficient homes without making misleading claims about the product's own environmental benefits.
